name: Sal Ferrarello (@salcode@phpc.social)
summary:
@www.jvt.me@www.jvt.me Thanks for writing this post. I hadn't considered that the output of `git push --force` includes the old commit hash - good to know!

One suggestion, instead of `git push --force`, perhaps you'd consider using `git push --force-with-lease` instead

In my experience, `--force-with-lease` is nearly always a better option.

I've even written my notes about it at https://salferrarello.com/never-git-push-force/

Thanks!
